entry.title: I Look in People's Windows
entry.summary:
Author: emmacchiatoo

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,323Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 1

Summary: Sol Alvarez-Ferrer didn‚Äôt come to Gotham to be a headline.She came to observe.New city, new job, and a last name people recognize before they recognize her. Armed with a camera, a notebook, and a habit of noticing what others overlook, Sol begins to map a city that watches back.Gotham doesn‚Äôt give itself away easily.Some people notice her.Some linger.Some protect her from the shadows.And once you notice someone‚Äîit‚Äôs hard to look away.

entry.title: delayed satisfaction is the sweetest
entry.summary:
Author: dreamtiming

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,830Chapters: 2/4Kudos: 66

Summary: ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs why you keep asking to go on patrol with me, right? My cutting intellect?‚Äù He asks, dipping a fry from his takeout box in a pool of ketchup. You wonder if the splotch on his sleeve is from a rather exuberant dip, or if it‚Äôs blood from earlier. ‚ÄúAmong other things.‚Äù You say, feeling like it‚Äôs finally your turn to offer someone an ambiguous response. Especially as he returns to this topic of conversation he is so insistent on having out with you. For emphasis, you take a great bite of your food to allot you more time to muster defenses. ‚ÄúWhat other things?‚Äù Jason presses, because it might work with someone else‚Äîbut not him, who, with no protection of the mask to guide his face, bores his eyes into you. ‚ÄúLike the fact that you paid for the food.‚Äù You offer gleefully, both of you knowing this is unsatisfactory. ‚ÄúCan‚Äôt be the only thing.‚Äù He says, his tone surprisingly level. Why on earth is your heart beating so fast? tl;dr: stuck in the middle with you. Dick Grayson/Reader/Jason Todd

entry.title: an angel is near
entry.summary:
Author: twinflamedfool

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,000Chapters: 1/5Kudos: 23

Summary: For all that your father preaches about never killing, you‚Äôve never been particularly attached to the rule, though you did follow it religiously. However, when the Joker kills Jason, all bets are off. Of course, the consequences of cold-blooded murder mean that you‚Äôve been forcibly retired, your family cannot stand to look at you, and most importantly, you have been put under lock and key, or as close as you can get to that in the modern age, especially when you're a beloved, local celebrity. You can live with that if it means your brother is rightfully avenged, but what are you to do when, a few years later, you gain a heart-achingly familiar stalker? You‚Äôd believe him a hallucination if he hadn‚Äôt swept you away from the only place you‚Äôve called home.
